result.execSummary:
The defendant Virgil Emery Erby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees by 03-14-2018 or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs
With credit for 2 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Virgil Emery Erby

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

VETERAN COURT

Based upon the defendant's compliance with Veterans Treatment Initiative Court, court finds the agreement is fulfilled.  Defendant is awarded with a Certificate and a Medallion of completion of Veterans Treatment Initiative.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve TWO (2) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for TWO (2) DAYS.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 03-14-2018 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

COURT REMOVED JUSTICEPOINT INVOLVEMENT FROM THIS CASE AND SUBSTITUTED THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF VETERAN'S AFFAIRS AS THE MONITOR.

Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  VTI/Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 33, the Veteran's Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned to branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Reports.

Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in court with Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  
Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Parties engaged in negotiations and attempting transfer of this matter to veteran's court.  Joint request for adjournment granted by the court; date selected.  Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense needs time to research getting the defendant designated into the mental health court.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - missed telephone contact.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is receiving in-patient treatment at the VA hospital.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24 is in trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court admonished the defendant as to his JusticePoint violations.  Defense needs time to discuss this matter with the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial ServicesViolation Report received and filed - missed telephone contact.

Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case called to address JusticePoint violation.  Court admonished the defendant.  Case remains calendared for plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  The defendant absconded.  Case called to address the JusticePoint violation.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 24.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 24.

Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Court orders reinstatement of JusticePoint monitoring. All previous conditions ordered are to be reinstated.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - missed telephone contact.  Violation to be addressed on next court date.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Stephen B.

Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Virgil Emery Erby in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
